author: Alex Michaelides
review: A gripping psychological thriller that will keep you guessing until the very end. It is a psychological thriller that will keep readers guessing until the very end. With its compelling plot, well-drawn characters, and atmospheric setting, it is sure to leave a lasting impression on fans of the genre.

author: Tara Westover
review: An astonishing memoir about overcoming obstacles through education. It is a deeply affecting memoir that resonates on multiple levels. It is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit, the transformative power of education, and the enduring quest for truth and self-understanding.

author: Delia Owens
review: 'Where the Crawdads Sing' is a beautifully written and emotionally resonant novel that captivates with its lyrical prose, richly drawn characters, and immersive storytelling. It is a testament to the enduring power of the human spirit and the transformative potential of love, even in the darkest of times.

author: Michelle Obama
review: An inspiring memoir that offers insights into life, leadership, and resilience. It is a powerful testament to the transformative power of resilience, empathy, and authenticity. Through her words, she inspires us to believe in the power of hope, courage, and the human capacity for change.

author: Erin Morgenstern
review: It is a spellbinding tale that will enchant readers with its whimsical charm, breathtaking imagery storytelling. It is about enduring power of love, imagination, and the magic that lies within us all. The story transports readers to a world where dreams are made real and the impossible becomes possible.

author: Charles Duhigg
review: A fascinating exploration of how habits shape our lives and how they can be changed.  Whether you're looking to break a bad habit, cultivate a positive one, or effect change on a larger scale, this book offers valuable insights and practical tools for transforming your habits and, by extension, your life.
